project.title: Google UX Coursera
project.description: Taking the Google UX course on Coursera to learn about UI/UX design

items.title: Empathy maps
items.description: A tool used for condensing results gathered by interviews. Can be a single user or multiple users of a single group. Has quadrants for what a user says, thinks, does, and feel.
items.whatWentWell: It seems straightforward and easy to understand
items.lessonsLearned: Learned a way of condensing interview results

items.title: Goal statement
items.description: A way of explaining what a product lets users do, who the action affects, why the action positively affects users, and how the effectiveness of the product is measured.
items.whatWentWell: Was able to understand it well and work through an example
items.whatDidNotGoWell: Tried it on my own for a project idea of mine, and realized that there were some gaps I had in my initial brainstorming
items.lessonsLearned: How to explain the goal of a product in a concise and effective manner

items.title: Rapid sketching
items.description: A way of coming up with ideas in researching. Do this by using a pen and paper to quickly come up with 8 ideas of something related to problem statement with 1 minute dedicated to each section
items.whatWentWell: Got to do something a bit more creative
items.whatDidNotGoWell: I had a hard time coming up with variations of the design
items.lessonsLearned: This is a useful tool, and I need to work on being able to come up with more variations of the design
